entries.author: Giacomo Cain

entries.title: Measles cases are rising, and RFK Jr. is only making it worse
entries.summary: <p>The number of <a class="Link" href="https://www.cdc.gov/measles/data-research/index.html" target="_blank" >measles cases </a>in the U.S. has soared over the past two years. In 2024, there were 285 reported cases, while in 2025, there were 2,280 cases. The <a class="Link" href="https://www.cdc.gov/measles/data-research/index.html" target="_blank" >number of cases</a> reported by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention as of Feb. 19 is 982 and growing. The U.S. is on track this year to have the <a class="Link" href="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/number-of-measles-cases" target="_blank" >most measles cases</a> since 1990. </p><p><a class="Link" href="https://dph.sc.gov/diseases-conditions/infectious-diseases/measles-rubeola/measles-dashboard" target="_blank" >South Carolina</a>, <a class="Link" href="https://thehill.com/homenews/5736370-map-which-states-have-the-most-measles-cases-in-2026/" target="_blank" >Utah</a> and <a class="Link" href="https://www.floridahealth.gov/diseases-and-conditions/disease/measles/" target="_blank" >Florida</a> are the states with the most cases so far this year. Illinois now has <a class="Link" href="https://dph.illinois.gov/topics-services/diseases-and-conditions/measles.html" target="_blank" >two cases</a>, according to the Illinois Department of Public Health.</p><p>This surge in cases places the U.S. at risk of losing its <a class="Link" href="https://www.astho.org/communications/blog/2026/understanding-current-us-measles-outbreaks-elimination-status/" target="_blank" >measles elimination status, which it has held since 2000</a>, largely driven by effective measles vaccination uptake.</p><p>Some may argue that measles is a <a class="Link" href="http://www.bowdish.ca/lab/2024/03/07/measles-is-not-a-harmless-childhood-infection-dr-bowdish-explains/" target="_blank" >harmless infectious disease</a>, so children having measles is more of an inconvenience than a risk. This is simply not true.</p><div class="RichTextSidebarModule Enhancement" data-module data-align-center><a class="AnchorLink" id="module-b20000" name="module-b20000"></a> <div class="RichTextSidebarModule-title">Commentary bug</div> <div class="RichTextModule-items RichTextBody"><h2>Commentary</h2></div> </div><p>Measles can cause an <a class="Link" href="https://www.uchicagomedicine.org/forefront/pediatrics-articles/measles-is-still-a-very-dangerous-disease" target="_blank" >acute encephalitis</a>, or swelling of the brain, as well as death.</p><p>On a practical note, when children are infected with measles, they must be kept out of school, forcing parents and their caregivers to miss time from <a class="Link" href="https://www.dol.gov/agencies/whd/fact-sheets/28-fmla" target="_blank" >work</a> to care for them. In 2025, of the 2,267 measles cases, <a class="Link" href="https://www.cdc.gov/measles/data-research/index.html" target="_blank" >11%</a> resulted in hospitalizations, and three of these patients died. Moreover, <a class="Link" href="https://www.cdc.gov/measles/data-research/index.html" target="_blank" >18% of children under 5</a> who were infected had to be hospitalized. All such data demonstrates that measles is more than just a benign infection.</p><p>Cases of measles are now surfacing at <a class="Link" href="https://www.ice.gov/" target="_blank" >Immigration and Customs Enforcement</a> (ICE) detention facilities in <a class="Link" href="https://www.powershealth.org/about-us/newsroom/health-library/2026/02/02/arizona-confirms-measles-case-in-ice-custody-as-state-total-rises" target="_blank" >Arizona</a> and <a class="Link" href="https://www.cbsnews.com/news/ice-dilley-center-texas-measles-cases/" target="_blank" >Texas</a>. Given measles‚Äô high <a class="Link" href="https://www.gideononline.com/blogs/understanding-the-basic-reproduction-number-r0-the-key-to-tracking-disease-spread/" target="_blank" >basic reproduction number</a>, R0, which measures the average number of new infections that a single infected person can spread in a completely susceptible population, dozens more cases are certain to be reported in the coming weeks.</p><p>What makes the uptick in measles cases so concerning is that it serves as the ‚Äú<a class="Link" href="https://www.smithsonianmag.com/smart-news/what-happened-canary-coal-mine-story-how-real-life-animal-helper-became-just-metaphor-180961570/" target="_blank" >canary in the mine shaft</a>‚Äù for other vaccine-preventable infectious diseases. <a class="Link" href="https://www.gavi.org/vaccineswork/contagion-scale-which-diseases-spread-fastest" target="_blank" >Measles is the most transmissible infectious disease that children contract</a>, with its R0 value <a class="Link" href="https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/28757186/" target="_blank" >between 12 and 18</a>. Other infectious diseases with high R0 value include <a class="Link" href="https://www.gavi.org/vaccineswork/contagion-scale-which-diseases-spread-fastest" target="_blank" >polio (12 to 17) and rubella (10-12)</a>.</p><p></p><h3>RFK Jr. fuels vaccine hesitancy</h3><h3></h3><p>People attribute this surge in measles cases to <a class="Link" href="https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC3906279/" target="_blank" >vaccine hesitancy</a>, which has been exacerbated and fanned by the <a class="Link" href="https://www.hhs.gov/" target="_blank" >Health and Human Services</a> secretary, <a class="Link" href="https://www.hhs.gov/about/leadership/robert-kennedy.html" target="_blank" >Robert F. Kennedy Jr.,</a> who has a long <a class="Link" href="https://dcimmunized.org/rfk-jr-says-hes-not-anti-vaccine/" target="_blank" >history of marginalizing</a> the use of vaccines to prevent diseases. He has continued to promulgate his personal beliefs and agenda by revamping the <a class="Link" href="https://cdc.gov/" target="_blank" >CDC</a> and its <a class="Link" href="https://www.cdc.gov/acip/index.html" target="_blank" >Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices</a>. Though vaccine hesitancy is certainly part of the risk calculus driving higher numbers of infections, the number of people <a class="Link" href="https://publichealth.jhu.edu/ivac/2025/across-the-us-childhood-vaccination-rates-continue-to-decline" target="_blank" >who continue to get vaccinated</a> and support vaccination for their children remains high, albeit not as high as it was six years ago.</p><p>The advisory committee also recently revamped the <a class="Link" href="https://www.kff.org/other-health/the-new-federal-vaccine-schedule-what-changed/" target="_blank" >childhood immunization schedule</a>, aligning it more closely with <a class="Link" href="https://vaccine-schedule.ecdc.europa.eu/Scheduler/ByCountry?SelectedCountryId=58&IncludeChildAgeGroup=true&IncludeChildAgeGroup=false&IncludeAdultAgeGroup=true&IncludeAdultAgeGroup=false" target="_blank" >Denmark‚Äôs schedule</a>. This resulted in six fewer diseases covered on the <a class="Link" href="https://www.kff.org/other-health/the-new-federal-vaccine-schedule-what-changed/" target="_blank" >U.S. schedule.</a> The change instituted by the advisory committee that impacted measles was the change at 12 months through 3 years, that the varicella vaccine should be given separately from the <a class="Link" href="https://www.cdc.gov/measles/vaccines/index.html" target="_blank" >measles, mumps, and rubella (MMR) vaccine</a>.</p><p>Much of the changed attitudes towards childhood vaccines appear to be driven by <a class="Link" href="https://www.kff.org/medicaid/kindergarten-routine-vaccination-rates-continue-to-decline/" target="_blank" >circulating misinformation about vaccines and a decline in trust in health authorities</a>. <a class="Link" href="https://publications.aap.org/pediatrics/article/156/2/e2025072714/202656/Medical-vs-Nonmedical-Immunization-Exemptions-for?autologincheck=redirected" target="_blank" >Non-medical vaccine exemptions </a>for school attendance have been <a class="Link" href="https://www.beckershospitalreview.com/quality/public-health/nonmedical-vaccine-exemptions-on-the-rise-4-things-to-know/" target="_blank" >on the rise</a>, creating <a class="Link" href="https://www.cnn.com/2026/01/14/health/vaccine-exemptions-county-risk-measles-vis" target="_blank" >pockets of disease outbreaks</a> and making it more difficult for school districts to achieve <a class="Link" href="https://historyofvaccines.org/vaccines-101/what-do-vaccines-do/how-herd-immunity-works" target="_blank" >herd immunity</a>.</p><p>Multiple decades of success with pediatric vaccines to protect against the plethora of childhood infectious diseases have confirmed their effectiveness and safety. <a class="Link" href="https://immunizationevidence.org/summary/vaccines-have-a-high-return-on-investment-every-1-spent-on-vaccine-programs-returns-up-to-44/" target="_blank" >Studies</a> have shown that money invested in childhood immunization has a positive return. Unfortunately, falsehoods and hesitancy about the COVID-19 vaccines fueled vaccine hesitancy against all vaccines, even those that have been well accepted for many decades.</p><p>The <a class="Link" href="https://www.aap.org/" target="_blank" >American Academy of Pediatrics</a> took it upon itself to issue its own recommended childhood <a class="Link" href="https://downloads.aap.org/AAP/PDF/AAP-Immunization-Schedule.pdf" target="_blank" >immunization schedule</a>, closely aligning with the schedule that was eliminated by the <a class="Link" href="https://www.cdc.gov/acip/index.html" target="_blank" >Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices</a>. In addition, the American College of Physicians <a class="Link" href="https://www.acpjournals.org/doi/10.7326/ANNALS-25-01576?_gl=1*13dhed3*_gcl_aw*R0NMLjE3Njk2MzUxMTkuRUFJYUlRb2JDaE1JdGZTRTk4U0dfUUlWTU9iakJ4Mjl3d3dzRUFBWUFTQUFFZ0lNRF9EX0J3RQ..*_gcl_dc*R0NMLjE3Njk2MzUxMTkuRUFJYUlRb2JDaE1JdGZTRTk4U0dfUUlWTU9iakJ4Mjl3d3dzRUFBWUFTQUFFZ0lNRF9EX0J3RQ..*_gcl_au*MTM2MTAzNzA3MC4xNzY3MDI4NDk5*_ga*ODAzOTk2OTI5LjE3NTgxMzEwNDM.*_ga_PM4F5HBGFQ*czE3Njk2MzUxMDEkbzI4JGcxJHQxNzY5NjM1MTcyJGo2MCRsMCRoMA..&_ga=2.148120436.2107346431.1769616888-803996929.1758131043&_gac=1.49611410.1769635102.EAIaIQobChMItfSE98SG_QIVMObjBx29wwwsEAAYASAAEgIMD_D_BwE" target="_blank" >supports</a> the previous 2025 advisory committee recommendations.</p><p>These are no ordinary times when it comes to immunization. <a class="Link" href="https://www.immunize.org/vaccines/vaccine-timeline/" target="_blank" >Vaccines developed over the past 70 years</a> have prevented numerous infections and saved countless lives. Returning to <a class="Link" href="https://www.healthychildren.org/English/safety-prevention/immunizations/Pages/Vaccination-Protects-Against-These-Diseases.aspx" target="_blank" >earlier times</a> when children routinely were infected with numerous childhood diseases is not a formula for healthy living. The best advice that parents can take is to look to professional medical societies that have an established record of supporting health and healthy living and allow them to become the beacon of guidance for protecting your children and yourself. Indeed, the lights of reliable guidance and recommendations that once shone from the CDC have tragically gone dark.</p><p><i>Sheldon H. Jacobson, Ph.D., is a computer science professor in the Grainger College of Engineering at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign. As a data scientist, he uses his expertise in risk-based analytics to address issues impacting public policy and public health.</i></p><p><i> Janet A. Jokela, M.D., is an infectious disease and public health physician, and clinical professor at Carle Illinois College of Medicine at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign.  She serves as a member of the Illinois Immunization Advisory Committee. </i></p><div class="RichTextSidebarModule Enhancement" data-module data-align-center><a class="AnchorLink" id="module-300000" name="module-300000"></a> <div class="RichTextModule-items RichTextBody">Send letters to <a class="Link" href="mailto:letters@suntimes.com" target="_blank" >letters@suntimes.com</a>. More about <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/submitting-opinion-and-letters" >how to submit here</a>.</div> </div><p></p>
entries.author: Janet A. Jokela, M.D.

entries.title: Man found dead with gunshot wounds in Lawndale
entries.summary: <p>A man was found fatally shot Saturday morning in the Lawndale neighborhood on the West Side.</p><p>The unidentified adult was found unresponsive with multiple gunshot wounds to the torso at 8:23 a.m. in the 900 block of South Keeler, according to a statement from Chicago police. He was dead at the scene.</p><p>The circumstances were unknown as Area Four detectives launched a homicide investigation.</p>
entries.author: Sun-Times Wire

entries.title: Woman killed in Far South Side drive-by shooting
entries.summary: <p>One woman was killed and another wounded in an East Side neighborhood drive-by shooting early Saturday on the Far South Side.</p><p>Just after 1 a.m., both women, ages 29 and 37, were in a crowd gathered in a parking lot in the 10200 block of South Avenue J when someone opened fire from a passing blue vehicle, according to a statement from Chicago police.</p><p>The older woman was hit in the leg and the younger in the chest. They were taken to the University of Chicago Medical Center, where the 29-year-old later died, police said.</p><p>The 37-year-old was listed in good condition. No one was in custody as detectives investigated Saturday morning.</p>
entries.author: Sun-Times Wire

entries.title: As Stratton airs ad with anti-Trump expletive, Krishnamoorthi launches first negative TV ad attacking her
entries.summary: <p>As Juliana Stratton runs a campaign ad uttering the words "F*** Trump, her U.S. Senate rival U.S. Rep. Raja Krishnamoorthi is airing the first negative TV ad targeting the lieutenant governor.</p><p>The final weeks of a heated U.S. Senate race have <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/elections/2026/01/26/senate-debate-illinois-krishnamoorthi-stratton-kelly" target="_blank" >proven to be feisty during live forums and debates,</a> but a bit tamer on television ‚Äî until now. Krishnamoorthi's foray into an attack ad is the first to go negative on television in the statewide race to replace retiring U.S. Sen. Dick Durbin. And it comes as Stratton airs her first TV ad ‚Äî and a pro-Stratton super PAC with <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/elections/2026/01/31/juliana-stratton-jb-pritzker-campaign-contribution-5-million" target="_blank" >$5 million of Gov. JB Pritzker‚Äôs dollars</a> being used to run pro-Stratton ads.</p><p>Krishnamoorthi's campaign framed it as a response to "six months of repeated attacks from Juliana Stratton."</p><p><a class="Link" href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XhaGqq4ToO0" target="_blank" >The 30-second ad</a> cites a Sun-Times story that shows Stratton's <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/the-watchdogs/2025/11/21/juliana-stratton-us-senate-bid-march-primary-corporate-pac-money" target="_blank" >history of receiving money from corporate owners and directors</a> into her state campaign funds, despite her Senate campaign disavowing corporate PAC money. It claims Stratton took MAGA donor money, citing research from Krishnamoorthi's campaign. The Sun-Times reported Stratton received a $2,500 contribution from Union Pacific in September 2024 into her state campaign fund, which can‚Äôt be used for her Senate run. The corporate PAC helped fund the White House ballroom. U.S. Rep. Robin Kelly, another contender in the Democratic primary race for Durbin‚Äôs seat, also received contributions from PACs affiliated with the fund.</p><p>The ad also cites a CBS story that reported a Stratton super PAC received a six-figure donation from ICE contractor CoreCivic. That was in reference to the Democratic Lieutenant Governor's Association PAC, which has said they'll donate money to the National Immigration Law Center. It also mentions an error on the part of Illinois Future PAC, a super PAC created to support Stratton, which had to update an ad after Krishnamoorthi‚Äôs campaign noted it appeared to violate federal campaign finance law by failing to disclose that it was not authorized by Stratton or her campaign. The PAC quickly updated the ad. </p><p>"Juliana Stratton. Corporate and MAGA donations, ICE contractor money, accused of breaking federal laws," the ad's narrator says. "Hypocrisy we can't trust."</p><p><a class="Link" href="https://www.instagram.com/reel/DU8q15METdr/" target="_blank" >Stratton aired her first TV ad on Feb. 19</a>, which features five people blankly stating, "F*** Trump," and details her support for abolishing ICE and to "hold Trump accountable for the crimes he's committed." Others join in on the expletive, including U.S. Sen. Tammy Duckworth, who has endorsed Stratton. Pritzker is also featured in the ad, but does not swear.</p><p>"Vote Juliana," Pritzker says. </p><p>The expletives are bleeped on television, but not online. </p><p>Stratton's campaign has aired negative digital ads targeting Krishnamoorthi since August, but not on television. Krishnamoorthi has raised more than $28 million in the race and has been <a class="Link" href="https://www.google.com/search?q=raja+krishnamoorthi+first+tv+ad&sca_esv=2df5d5c022344074&biw=1435&bih=713&tbm=nws&sxsrf=ANbL-n5AKKvwQZKEZEeiHTzWbcmbKHwWcw%3A1771632461897&ei=TfeYaYq9NpXAp84Pxtu8mA4&ved=0ahUKEwjKl8GcpemSAxUV4MkDHcYtD-MQ4dUDCBA&uact=5&oq=raja+krishnamoorthi+first+tv+ad&gs_lp=Egxnd3Mtd2l6LW5ld3MiH3JhamEga3Jpc2huYW1vb3J0aGkgZmlyc3QgdHYgYWRIhhFQ3wVYjhBwAXgAkAEAmAF3oAHVCqoBBDEyLjO4AQPIAQD4AQGYAgWgAvIDwgIFECEYoAHCAgsQABiABBiRAhiKBcICBhAAGBYYHsICCxAAGIAEGLEDGIMBwgIFEAAYgASYAwCIBgGSBwMzLjKgB9EasgcDMy4yuAfyA8IHBTEuMS4zyAcQgAgA&sclient=gws-wiz-news" target="_blank" >airing ads since July</a>. He had $15.2 million cash on hand at the end of December, according to the Federal Election Commission. Stratton had $1.1 million for the same time period, and Kelly had $1.59 million. Kelly is also airing TV ads for the final four weeks of the campaign. </p><p>Other Democrats vying for the race are Steve Botsford Jr., Sean Brown, Awisi A. Bustos, Jonathan Dean, Bryan Maxwell, Kevin Ryan and Christopher Swann.</p>
entries.author: Tina Sfondeles

entries.title: Chicago clergy kick off funeral services with tribute to Rev. Jesse Jackson
entries.summary: <p>Deborah Cosey-Lane couldn't help but grow emotional as she listened to clergy from across Chicago honor Rev. Jesse Jackson‚Äôs life and legacy during a heartfelt tribute Saturday morning at the headquarters of the Rainbow PUSH Coalition.</p><p>‚ÄúI still have life in me because I have hope,‚Äù said Cosey-Lane, 60. ‚ÄúThat hope was instilled because the reverend kept pouring it in when I looked like I was empty and like I was hopeless.‚Äù</p><p>Cosey-Lane was one of dozens who gathered for Rainbow PUSH‚Äôs Saturday morning forum kicking off funeral services for Jackson, who <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/obituaries/2026/02/17/rev-jesse-jackson-civil-rights-leader-rainbow-push-obituary" >died peacefully Tuesday at the age of 84</a>.</p><p>Jackson founded the Rainbow PUSH Coalition in 1970.</p><p>Cosey-Lane met Jackson in 2016 after moving from St. Louis to Chicago and said he was instrumental in helping her ‚Äúfight for herself.‚Äù She met the civil rights icon when she served as a leader in the Amalgamated Transit Union, and said he stood with them as they pushed for stronger contracts.</p><p>‚ÄúAnd as a woman surrounded by men in leadership, he always encouraged me to not listen to the noise and always keep your faith,‚Äù said Cosey-Lane.</p><p>During the tribute, clergy from across the city gave tribute to Jackson by sharing stories of the reverend‚Äôs impact.</p><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="Enhancement-item" data-crop=""> <figure class="Figure"><a class="AnchorLink" id="image-680000" name="image-680000"></a> Michael Eaddy of the People‚Äôs Church of the Harvest speaks during the Saturday Morning Forum at Rainbow PUSH Coalition in Kenwood, Saturday, Feb. 21, 2026.</p></figcaption><span class="line"></span><div class="Figure-credit"><p>Pat Nabong/Sun-Times</p></div></div> </figure> </div> </div><p>Rev. Michael Eaddy of the People‚Äôs Church of the Harvest in East Garfield Park said Jackson inspired him to take social action.</p><p>‚ÄúHe inspired me in my role and as a pastor not to be confined to my church building nor to my congregants only, but to make an impact on my community and people at large,‚Äù said Eaddy.</p><p>Jackson <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/news/2026/10-facts-reverend-jesse-jackson-sr-chicago-connection" >rose to prominence</a> in the 1960s as a prot√©g√© of the Rev. Martin Luther King Jr.. The reverend joined King‚Äôs cause and carried that mission to Chicago, where he championed key causes of the Civil Rights Movement, including racial equality, economic justice and human rights.</p><p>‚ÄúHe was my hero. He was my mentor,‚Äù said Eaddy.</p><p>Jackson‚Äôs wife, Jacqueline Jackson, and children sat in the front row during the forum while members of the community filled almost every seat in Rainbow PUSH‚Äôs South Side auditorium.</p><p>Rev. Ciera Bates-Chamberlain said the best way to honor Jackson was to continue to ‚Äúkeep hope alive,‚Äù the signature rallying cry of the late reverend.</p><p>‚ÄúDr. King gave us a dream and he spoke of a dream,‚Äù said Bates-Chamberlain, executive director of Live Free Illinois. ‚ÄúThe Rev. Jackson spoke of hope.‚Äù</p><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="Enhancement-item"> <bsp-carousel class="Carousel Enhancement" data-align-center> <a class="AnchorLink" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/environment/2026/02/20/jesse-jacksons-vision-for-america-embraced-environmental-justice" >Jesse Jackson‚Äôs vision for America embraced environmental justice</a> </li> <li class="RelatedList-items-item"> <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/photography/2026/02/21/how-we-photographed-the-impact-of-rev-jesse-jacksons-death" >How we photographed the impact of Rev. Jesse Jackson‚Äôs death</a> </li> </ul> </div> <p>Demetrice Pearson, 62, said she would ‚Äúkeep hope alive‚Äù by serving her community and teaching others about Jackson.</p><p>‚ÄúHe gave his life to helping people and serving people,‚Äù said Pearson, a member of Rainbow PUSH.</p><p>Services <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/chicago/2026/02/17/what-we-know-rev-jesse-jacksons-death-services" >will continue as Jackson lies in state</a> Thursday, Feb. 26, and Friday, Feb. 27, at Rainbow PUSH‚Äôs Kenwood headquarters at 930 E. 50th St. The services both days will start at 10 a.m.</p><p>His remains will then travel to South Carolina and Washington D.C. from March 1-5.</p><p>A ‚ÄúPeople‚Äôs Celebration‚Äù in Chicago will be held at 10 a.m. March 6, at House of Hope, 752 E. 114th St. Doors open at 9 a.m.</p><p>Private homegoing services are scheduled for 10 a.m. March 7, at Rainbow PUSH. Doors open at 8 a.m., with limited capacity.</p>
entries.author: Cindy Hernandez

entries.title: Review: Brandi Carlisle shows she still has the human touch in first arena tour
entries.summary: <p>Brandi Carlile couldn‚Äôt get Minneapolis off her mind on Friday night.</p><p>‚ÄúTomorrow we‚Äôll play a show for the state of Minnesota and for everything they just did for the rest of this country,‚Äù the singer-songwriter and activist said to a huge swell of applause at the sold-out Allstate Arena. She was referencing the recent announcement that her Twin Cities show Saturday would be turned into an audio and visual livestream benefiting The Advocates for Human Rights, with her show in Rosemont feeling like the warmup.</p><p>The messages were everywhere throughout the arena. Carlile shared that her Looking Out Foundation had already raised $25,000 for legal aid for those impacted by the Trump administration‚Äôs immigration campaign in Minnesota where Alex Pretti and Renee Good were fatally shot last month by Immigration and Customs Enforcement, and encouraged attendees to also donate. On tables in the lobby, there were opportunities to write #Bramily (Brandi Family) postcards that would be distributed at the next tour stop, with the intention of providing love and encouragement to a fellow fan.</p><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="Enhancement-item" data-crop=""> <figure class="Figure"><a class="AnchorLink" id="image-e20000" name="image-e20000"></a> 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/23e7ccf/2147483647/strip/true/crop/3000x1684+0+158/resize/980x550!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F11%2Fe8%2F877a4f4b4541b958e85067c19a02%2Fbrandicarlile-260221-10.jpg data-lazy-load="true" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" > </picture> <div class="Figure-content"><figcaption class="Figure-caption"><p>Brandi Carlile performs Friday at Allstate Arena in Rosemont. The singer-songwriter has racked up considerable creds over the years: 11 Grammys, two Emmys and one Oscar nomination. </p></figcaption><span class="line"></span><div class="Figure-credit"><p>Tyler Pasciak LaRiviere/Sun-Times</p></div></div> </figure> </div> </div><p>‚ÄúThe plight of displaced people, people who have left their homes in search of safety, of a better life, is the defining test of our humanity in this time and age,‚Äù she added in her speech, which elicited more voluminous hollering.</p><p>For Carlile, this is the essence of her Human Tour.</p><p>The star‚Äôs latest jaunt comes at an interesting time. It kicked off just days after she delivered a rousing performance of ‚ÄúAmerica the Beautiful‚Äù at the Super Bowl, further putting her on the national stage with a message of unity. It also marks her first-ever arena tour.</p><p>‚ÄúWe have all these lights and fake fog and s---,‚Äù she joked of the high-def stage setup where she was joined by seven additional musicians, including longtime musical partners, ‚Äúthe twins‚Äù Phil and Tim Hanseroth, as well as the Milwaukee-based violinist and cellist duo SistaStrings that had also accompanied her at the Super Bowl. ‚ÄúIt feels monstrous,‚Äù Carlile added, recounting the previous times she played the city at the much smaller Schubas, Metro and Park West.</p><p>In the years since, Carlile has racked up considerable creds: 11 Grammys, two Emmys and one Oscar nomination. She‚Äôs collaborated with her childhood hero Elton John, helped pull Joni Mitchell out of retirement, created her own festival (Girls Just Wanna Weekend) and become a producer in her own right. She‚Äôs an LGBTQ icon and beloved across genres from Americana to alt-rock, even working with her fellow Seattleites Soundgarden.</p><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="Enhancement-item" data-crop=""> <figure class="Figure"><a class="AnchorLink" id="image-e80000" name="image-e80000"></a> <picture data-crop="medium"> <source type="image/webp" width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/d188b52/2147483647/strip/true/crop/3000x1684+0+157/resize/490x275!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fd8%2F51%2F45fb2188499b993b642c9c6e8975%2Fbrandicarlile-260221-40.jpg data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <img class="Image" alt="Brandi Carlile performs Friday at Allstate Arena in Rosemont." srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/d38c7d7/2147483647/strip/true/crop/3000x1684+0+157/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fd8%2F51%2F45fb2188499b993b642c9c6e8975%2Fbrandicarlile-260221-40.jpg 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/825a580/2147483647/strip/true/crop/3000x1684+0+157/resize/980x550!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fd8%2F51%2F45fb2188499b993b642c9c6e8975%2Fbrandicarlile-260221-40.jpg 2x" width="490" height="275" data-src="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/d38c7d7/2147483647/strip/true/crop/3000x1684+0+157/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fd8%2F51%2F45fb2188499b993b642c9c6e8975%2Fbrandicarlile-260221-40.jpg" data-lazy-load="true" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" > </picture> <div class="Figure-content"><figcaption class="Figure-caption"><p>Brandi Carlile performs Friday at Allstate Arena in Rosemont. Her Twin Cities show Saturday will be turned into an audio and visual livestream benefiting The Advocates for Human Rights, with her show in Rosemont feeling like the warmup.</p></figcaption><span class="line"></span><div class="Figure-credit"><p>Tyler Pasciak LaRiviere/Sun-Times</p></div></div> </figure> </div> </div><p>This tour could‚Äôve been Carlile‚Äôs well-deserved diva moment ‚Äî she just sold out two nights at the holy grail, Madison Square Garden. And even though she‚Äôs reached stardom, she has remained true to the principles that have always made her the people‚Äôs artist.</p><p>This perspective was apparent from the opening notes Friday night. As Carlile kicked off the two-plus-hour set with the title track from her new album, ‚ÄúReturning to Myself,‚Äù she did so in silhouette from behind a large curtain that displayed a giant orange orb, conjuring the image of a baby inside the womb. As the show rolled into ‚ÄúHuman,‚Äù and the curtain dropped, the birth of the world via celestial images came into play, which eventually eclipsed her own visage.</p><p>The interplay of these two songs was key to the whole show ‚Äî Carlile is not only questioning her place in her own life but life at large. It‚Äôs an introspectiveness she‚Äôs always put into her music and why she‚Äôs become so relatable in the process. It‚Äôs why her heart-wrenching music syncs at just the right moments in ‚ÄúGrey‚Äôs Anatomy‚Äù nearly 20 years ago led to the path she‚Äôs on now.</p><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="Enhancement-item" data-crop=""> <figure class="Figure"><a class="AnchorLink" id="image-450000" name="image-450000"></a> <picture data-crop="medium"> <source type="image/webp" width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/caf9796/2147483647/strip/true/crop/3000x1684+0+158/resize/490x275!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Ffa%2F47%2F5451581d405590e9190b5fb7ad4b%2Fbrandicarlile-260221-11.jpg 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/d7b944f/2147483647/strip/true/crop/3000x1684+0+158/resize/980x550!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Ffa%2F47%2F5451581d405590e9190b5fb7ad4b%2Fbrandicarlile-260221-11.jpg 2x" data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <source width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/04c3d06/2147483647/strip/true/crop/3000x1684+0+158/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Ffa%2F47%2F5451581d405590e9190b5fb7ad4b%2Fbrandicarlile-260221-11.jpg" data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <img class="Image" alt="Brandi Carlile performs at Allstate Arena in suburban Rosemont, Friday, Feb. 20, 2026. " srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/04c3d06/2147483647/strip/true/crop/3000x1684+0+158/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Ffa%2F47%2F5451581d405590e9190b5fb7ad4b%2Fbrandicarlile-260221-11.jpg 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/dfd159b/2147483647/strip/true/crop/3000x1684+0+158/resize/980x550!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Ffa%2F47%2F5451581d405590e9190b5fb7ad4b%2Fbrandicarlile-260221-11.jpg 2x" width="490" height="275" data-src="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/04c3d06/2147483647/strip/true/crop/3000x1684+0+158/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Ffa%2F47%2F5451581d405590e9190b5fb7ad4b%2Fbrandicarlile-260221-11.jpg" data-lazy-load="true" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" > </picture> <div class="Figure-content"><figcaption class="Figure-caption"><p>Brandi Carlile performs Friday at Allstate Arena in Rosemont. She released her latest album, ‚ÄúReturning To Myself,‚Äù performing many of the album‚Äôs tracks Friday. </p></figcaption><span class="line"></span><div class="Figure-credit"><p>Tyler Pasciak LaRiviere/Sun-Times</p></div></div> </figure> </div> </div><p>But the fame also gave her pause. ‚ÄúReturning To Myself,‚Äù released in October, is Carlile getting back to her roots after years working with icons and legends and becoming a wife and mother. With her family present in the arena, Carlile proudly played nearly every song on the album, which also revolves around midlife themes of losing time (‚ÄúA War With Time‚Äù) and relationship battles (‚ÄúNo One Knows Us‚Äù).</p><p>Carlile also performed a few cuts from her 2025 collaborative album with Sir Elton, ‚ÄúWho Believes in Angels?‚Äù and covers including a haunting delivery of Alanis Morissette‚Äôs ‚ÄúUninvited‚Äù and a tearjerker take on Linda Ronstadt‚Äôs ‚ÄúLong Long Time,‚Äù all of it done with her incredible storyteller wisdom and that soaring voice that rips into your chest and holds your heart.</p><p>By the encore, featuring a group effort including openers The Head and the Heart on Coldplay‚Äôs ‚ÄúViva La Vida,‚Äù the takeaway was clear: Long live life, and long live performers like Brandi Carlile that add so much to it.</p><p><i>Brandi Carlile‚Äôs ‚ÄúBe A Human: A Concert For Minneapolis‚Äù airs at 7 p.m. Feb. 21 on VEEPS; find more info </i><a class="Link" href="https://veeps.com/brandicarlile/10bee30f-604a-40a8-9c39-6a0a6553d878?utm_source=press&utm_medium=organic&utm_campaign=press-brandicarlile" target="_blank" ><i><u>here. </u></i></a></p><h3>Brandi Carlile set list for Feb. 20 show at Allstate Arena</h3><p>Returning to Myself<br>Human<br>Mainstream Kid<br>Swing for the Fences (Brandi Carlile and Elton John song)<br>A War With Time<br>A Woman Oversees<br>Right On Time<br>Who Believes in Angels? (Brandi Carlile and Elton John song)<br>Hiding My Heart<br>Stay Gentle<br>You Without Me<br>The Mother<br>The Story<br>You and Me on the Rock<br>No One Knows Us<br>Sinners, Saints and Fools<br>Long Long Time (Linda Ronstadt cover)<br>The Joke<br>Hold Out Your Hand</p><p><b>Encore</b><br>Viva La Vida (Coldplay cover, with The Head and the Heart)<br>Church & State<br>Uninvited (Alanis Morissette cover)<br>A Long Goodbye</p>
entries.author: Selena Fragassi

entries.title: Shootout near Bridgeview pool hall leaves man dead, concealed-carry holder wounded
entries.summary: <p>A shootout in the parking lot of a southwest suburban pool hall left a man dead and another wounded early Saturday.</p><p>Authorities responded at 2:11 a.m. to the shooting outside Que Ball Sports Bar, 7735 S. Harlem Ave., according to a statement from Bridgeview Police Chief Ricardo Mancha.</p><p>A group of people were playing inside the pool hall about 2 a.m. when another group walked in, Mancha said through a spokesman, citing preliminary information.</p><p>When the first group left about 10 minutes later, the second group followed them outside and ‚Äúwords were exchanged,‚Äù Mancha said.</p><p>A man in the second group ‚Äúbrandished a handgun,‚Äù prompting a concealed-carry license holder in the first group to grab a gun from his vehicle, according to police.</p><p>They exchanged fire, and the man from the second group was hit multiple times. He was taken to Christ Medical Center in Oak Lawn, where he was pronounced dead within the hour, police said.</p><p>The concealed-carry license holder was hit in the torso and taken to the same hospital in critical but stable condition, police said.</p><p>Neighboring police agencies were called to help oversee a crowd that gathered in the parking lot. Detectives recovered the CCL holder‚Äôs gun and numerous shell casings at the scene.</p><p>The Cook County Medical Examiner‚Äôs Office had not released the name of the man who was killed as of Saturday afternoon, and no charges had been filed in the case.</p>
entries.author: Mitchell Armentrout

entries.title: Lenyn Sosa hoping to make White Sox' roster without a permanent spot
entries.summary: <p>GLENDALE, Ariz. ‚Äî Lenyn Sosa devoted the offseason to working on his defensive range while playing for Caracas in the Veneuzelan Winter League.</p><p>But will it be enough to earn a spot on the White Sox‚Äôs opening day roster, considering he doesn‚Äôt have a permanent position despite hitting a team-leading 22 home runs in 2025?</p><p>‚ÄúI don‚Äôt really pay attention to what my role is,‚Äù Sosa said Saturday. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs just trying to get better every day and do the best for me every day.‚Äù</p><p>Compounding the situation is that Sosa is out of minor league options, so he would be exposed to waivers if he doesn‚Äôt make the opening day roster. He came up through the Sox‚Äôs system as a shortstop but transition to second base before reaching the majors in 2022.</p><p>Chase Meidroth, however, seized most of the playing time at second during the latter stages of 2025, and Sosa was assessed with a minus-10 defensive runs saved at second. Miguel Vargas will be the Sox‚Äôs starting third baseman, and Sosa‚Äôs chances of starting at first base, where he played 42 games last season, diminished when the Sox signed Munetaka Murakami to a two-year, $34 million contract.</p><p>Newcomers Luisangel Acuna and Tanner Murray also can play multiple infield positions, although Acuna is expected to get a long look at center field.</p><p>Sosa, meanwhile, intends to be more aggressive on first pitches and has no intention of raising his 3.3 percent walk rate.</p><p>‚ÄúThe plan for this year is to be even more aggressive,‚Äù Sosa said. ‚ÄúWhat I mean with that is just trying to really crush pitches that are in the strike zone.‚Äù</p><h3>Murakami on the move</h3><p>The plan for Munetaka Murakami is to start Sunday and Monday, followed by a day off on Tuesday. Venable indicated Murakami, who had two hits and two RBIs in his Cactus League debut Friday, likely would play Thursday and Friday before departing for Japan to train for the World Baseball Classic.</p><p>In other scheduling news, pitchers Mike Vasil and Sean Burke are scheduled to pitch Sunday against the Brewers, and Shane Smith, Seranthony Dominguez and Grant Taylor are lined up to pitch Monday against the Rockies.</p><h3>Aided by ABS</h3><p>Pitcher Aaron Hicks is a big fan of the Automated Ball-Strike (ABS) system, as evidenced by a ball that was overturned and resulted in a called third strike to Max Muncy of the Athletics in the third.</p><p>‚ÄúI've been telling people I think I might be one of the biggest beneficiaries because that ride back sinker,‚Äù Hicks said. ‚ÄúI feel like umpires my whole career have just kind of given up on it. That's a really important pitch for me."</p><p>Hicks, who umpired youth games as a 16-year-old, didn‚Äôt mean to disrespect home plate umpire Charlie Ramos but was happy that catcher Edgar Quero requested the challenge.</p><p>‚ÄúAt the end of the day I think we're going to trust the catchers overall,‚Äù Hicks said. ‚ÄúI think they probably have the best zone awareness over a pitcher. They see hundreds of pitches come in every single day."</p><h3>Sox 11, Athletics 2</h3><p>‚Ä¢ Edgar Quero-run single in the first inning and poked an opposite-field two-run hit to right in the third. Brooks Baldwin, battling for an outfield spot, smacked a changeup for a home run to lead off the second as the Sox collected 14 hits.</p><p>‚Ä¢ Shortstop Colson Montgomery looked smooth while ranging to his right while avoiding a collision with third baseman Miguel Vargas and making an accurate throw to retire Colby Thomas for the second out in the first.</p><p>‚Ä¢ Left-hander Chris Murphy was delighted to throw first-pitch strikes to eight of the 10 batters he faced. He threw wild pitches, however, in the second inning that led to a run.</p><p>On deck: Sox vs. Brewers, Sunday, 2:05 p.m., Glendale, Ariz. CHSN. Mike Vasil vs. Logan Henderson.<br></p>
entries.author: Mark Gonzales

entries.title: White Sox' Andrew Benintendi impressed by young players' level heads
entries.summary: <p>GLENDALE, Ariz. ‚Äî While outfielder/designated hitter Andrew Benintendi did his best to play through a tender left Achilles tendon last summer, he was impressed by a development after the All-Star break that bodes well for the White Sox‚Äô future.</p><p>Much of the attention in 2025 centered on the breakout seasons by rookies Colson Montgomery and Kyle Teel, as well as American League All-Star pitcher Shane Smith.</p><p>And as the Sox attempt to take more strides toward respectability and eventual title contention in the AL Central, there has been no trace of contentment or complacency since full-squad workouts started a week ago.</p><p>Benintendi was a 21-year-old rookie on a veteran Red Sox team that won the AL East in 2016, so he knows the importance of fulfilling high expectations.</p><p>‚Äò‚ÄòIt‚Äôs a credit to those guys,‚Äô‚Äô Benintendi said Saturday. ‚Äò‚ÄòLast year, we had 19 rookies. It would probably be a little easier to come into that thinking, like, ‚ÄòOh, I‚Äôm in the big leagues,‚Äô and get a big head about it. But, no, everybody is in here to work. Everybody doesn‚Äôt take for granted where they are. Nothing‚Äôs guaranteed, and I think everybody here understands that.</p><p>‚Äò‚ÄòEverybody here has got a level head. I think they understand, as well, that we‚Äôre not where we want to be, and I think they know what the work is going to look like and what they have to put into it. So it‚Äôs been great to be around these guys.‚Äô‚Äô</p><p>The youngsters‚Äô eagerness to improve, such as Montgomery addressing ways to improve his contact rate, please manager Will Venable.</p><p>‚Äò‚ÄòYou get exposed to the big leagues, you understand how challenging it is,‚Äô‚Äô Venable said. ‚Äò‚ÄòThere‚Äôs things that you‚Äôre going to have to do to not just perform well but just to survive in this league.</p><p>‚Äò‚ÄòAnd those guys got a taste of it, and I think from each one of those guys, they‚Äôre just extremely competitive. They know what it takes to put in the work, build these routines and kind of the foundation that we continue to talk about on a daily basis.‚Äô‚Äô</p><p>Benintendi, meanwhile, gradually is working his way back after coping with inflammation and tendinitis in the Achilles that eventually sent him to the injured list for the final week of the regular season. He played much of the second half despite the discomfort but said he never was in danger of tearing the tendon and still managed to hit 20 home runs.</p><p>‚Äò‚ÄòI think getting out of the box was the biggest thing,‚Äô‚Äô Benintendi said. ‚Äò‚ÄòYou take a swing, and then your first push off is that back leg. I think we were pretty careful with it.‚Äô‚Äô</p><p>Nevertheless, the injury limited Benintendi‚Äôs range, and Venable intimated his playing time in left field might be curbed, especially with plenty of competition for outfield spots. He went 0-for-3 in DH duties in the Sox‚Äô spring game Saturday against the Athletics.</p><p>‚Äò‚ÄòWe want to be mindful of what he‚Äôs been through physically and make sure he‚Äôs in a good spot,‚Äô‚Äô Venable said. ‚Äò‚ÄòHe‚Äôs going to be having at-bats this year at the DH spot, so that‚Äôs something we want him to embrace. He‚Äôll also be out in the outfield, and we value his defense out there.‚Äô‚Äô</p>
entries.author: Mark Gonzales

entries.title: Blackhawks trade deadline preview: Connor Murphy, Jason Dickinson, other veterans could be moved out
entries.summary: <p>For the fifth time in five seasons under general manager Kyle Davidson, the <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/blackhawks" target="_blank" >Blackhawks</a> will be sellers at the trade deadline.</p><p>This time, however, the rationale is a bit different. The Hawks are no longer trying to worsen their NHL roster or urgently accumulate as many draft picks as possible.</p><p>Picks are still valuable to them, but the main reason why they need to ship out a few veterans before this year's March 6 deadline is to free up roster spots for prospects graduating into the NHL.</p><p>Forward prospects Anton Frondell, Nick Lardis and potentially Sacha Boisvert (if he turns pro) need opportunities, and it would also be nice to open another defensive spot for the group of Sam Rinzel, Kevin Korchinski and Ethan Del Mastro.</p><p>The deadline is less than two weeks away, with zero home games scheduled between now and then. The league's roster freeze for the Olympics will lift late Sunday night, and moves could happen at any time. The Hawks' biggest trade last year (the <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/blackhawks/2025/03/01/blackhawks-nhl-trade-deadline-preview-seth-jones-ryan-donato-lukas-reichel" target="_blank" >Seth Jones blockbuster</a>) went down six days before the deadline.</p><p>Five pending unrestricted free agents ‚Äî forwards Jason Dickinson, Ilya Mikheyev and Nick Foligno and defensemen Connor Murphy and Matt Grzelcyk ‚Äî are the primary players the Hawks will shop around. It would be surprising to see anybody else moved.</p><p>That's because the Hawks are obviously prioritizing young players, and they'll also likely need their four remaining veteran forwards (Andre Burakovsky, Tyler Bertuzzi, Teuvo Teravainen and Ryan Donato) and their cap hits to reach the salary floor next season.</p><h3><b>Trade options</b></h3><p>There are countless ways this deadline could play out, but it seems almost certain that at least a couple of those five UFAs will be moved ‚Äî at least one of the forwards and one of the defensemen.</p><p>Dickinson and Murphy seem most likely. They have both <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/blackhawks/2026/01/28/blackhawks-connor-murphy-reflects-on-tenure-chicago-home-patience" target="_blank" >talked openly</a> about the possibility while reflecting on their lengthy (four- and nine-year) Hawks tenures. </p><p>They're both consummate professionals who would appeal to contending teams for reasons beyond their on-ice impacts, and they both play positions (center and right defense) where teams often seek extra depth at the deadline.</p><p>The Hawks have two available salary-retention slots they could use to slash in half their $4.25 and $4.4 million cap hits, respectively, to make them easier for teams to absorb financially.</p><div class="RelatedList Enhancement" data-module data-align-center> <div data-lazy-load="true" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" > </picture> <div class="Figure-content"><figcaption class="Figure-caption"><p>Jason Dickinson is a strong candidate to move at the deadline.</p></figcaption><span class="line"></span><div class="Figure-credit"><p>Patrick McDermott/Getty Images</p></div></div> </figure> </div> </div><p>But Murphy played extremely well in January ‚Äî while rookie Artyom Levshunov fell off a cliff ‚Äî and now seems relevant again to the Hawks' short-term defensive success (after getting temporarily phased into a minor role in November).</p><p>The Hawks don't want to capsize down the stretch, so if offers for Murphy don't blow them away, it's possible they could pivot and ship out Grzelcyk ($1 million cap hit) instead.</p><p>Davidson faces a similar conundrum with the forwards. Mikheyev has enjoyed a much better season than Dickinson ‚Äî for the second season in a row ‚Äî and is a key reason why the Hawks' sport the league's best penalty kill. His ability to translate between English and Russian also helps Levshunov and would help Roman Kantserov next season. Many Hawks fans are eager to see him re-signed.</p><p>But for those same reasons, trade interest in Mikheyev ($4 million cap hit) might prove much heartier than in Dickinson. If there's a big enough gap in offers, or if Mikheyev demands a longer-term next contract than the Hawks are willing to commit to, they could conceivably trade him and keep Dickinson instead.</p><p>Foligno is the wild card. The team captain playing out potentially his final NHL season will get to decide his own deadline fate, likely in an upcoming meeting with Davidson.</p><p>A trade seems unlikely, but once Davidson informs Foligno ($4.5 million cap hit) of his intention to sell, might one last playoff push with either the Blue Jackets or Bruins (his former teams) appeal to him?</p><h3><b>Asking prices</b></h3><p>The Hawks landing a second-round pick for any of those UFAs would be impressive. They'll likely ask for that, but contenders will likely respond that a third- or fourth-round pick is the most they're willing to offer.</p><p>Could the Hawks and their trade partners look further down the road to reach an agreement?</p><p>Most teams will value 2027 or 2028 picks slightly less than 2026 picks and be more willing to part with them, whereas the Hawks might actually <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/blackhawks/2025/12/17/blackhawks-future-draft-picks-trade-purposes-rebuild-kyle-davidson" target="_blank" >prefer</a> 2027 or 2028 picks. That's because they already own five picks in the first two rounds of 2026 and already have an enormous prospect pool.</p><p>Future picks could either help the Hawks space out their pipeline timeline-wise or give them more assets of predetermined value that they could turn around and trade for active NHL players in 2027 or 2028 (if they've become a contender by then).</p>
entries.author: Ben Pope

entries.title: Review: Brandi Carlile shows she still has the human touch in first arena tour
entries.summary: <p>Brandi Carlile couldn‚Äôt get Minneapolis off her mind on Friday night.</p><p>‚ÄúTomorrow we‚Äôll play a show for the state of Minnesota and for everything they just did for the rest of this country,‚Äù the singer-songwriter and activist said to a huge swell of applause at the sold-out Allstate Arena. She was referencing the recent announcement that her Twin Cities show Saturday would be turned into an audio and visual livestream benefiting The Advocates for Human Rights, with her show in Rosemont feeling like the warmup.</p><p>The messages were everywhere throughout the arena. Carlile shared that her Looking Out Foundation had already raised $25,000 for legal aid for those impacted by the Trump administration‚Äôs immigration campaign in Minnesota where Alex Pretti and Renee Good were fatally shot last month by Immigration and Customs Enforcement, and encouraged attendees to also donate. <b></b> On tables in the lobby, there were opportunities to write #Bramily (Brandi Family) postcards that would be distributed at the next tour stop, with the intention of providing love and encouragement to a fellow fan. <b></b></p><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="Figure-content"><figcaption class="Figure-caption"><p>Brandi Carlile performs Friday at Allstate Arena in Rosemont. The singer-songwriter has racked up considerable creds over the years: 11 Grammys, two Emmys and one Oscar nomination. </p></figcaption><span class="line"></span><div class="Figure-credit"><p>Tyler Pasciak LaRiviere/Sun-Times</p></div></div> </figure> </div> </div><p>‚ÄúThe plight of displaced people, people who have left their homes in search of safety, of a better life, is the defining test of our humanity in this time and age,‚Äù she added in her speech, which elicited more voluminous hollering.</p><p>For Carlile, this is the essence of her Human Tour.</p><p>The star‚Äôs latest jaunt comes at an interesting time. It kicked off just days after she delivered a rousing performance of ‚ÄúAmerica the Beautiful‚Äù at the Super Bowl, further putting her on the national stage with a message of unity. It also marks her first-ever arena tour.</p><p>‚ÄúWe have all these lights and fake fog and s---,‚Äù she joked of the high-def stage setup where she was joined by seven additional musicians, including longtime musical partners, ‚Äúthe twins‚Äù Phil and Tim Hanseroth, as well as the Milwaukee-based violinist and cellist duo SistaStrings that had also accompanied her at the Super Bowl. ‚ÄúIt feels monstrous,‚Äù Carlile added, recounting the previous times she played the city at the much smaller Schubas, Metro and Park West.</p><p>In the years since, Carlile has racked up considerable creds: 11 Grammys, two Emmys and one Oscar nomination. She‚Äôs collaborated with her childhood hero Elton John, helped pull Joni Mitchell out of retirement, created her own festival (Girls Just Wanna Weekend) and become a producer in her own right. She‚Äôs an LGBTQ icon and beloved across genres from Americana to alt-rock, even working with her fellow Seattleites Soundgarden.</p><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="Figure-content"><figcaption class="Figure-caption"><p>Brandi Carlile performs Friday at Allstate Arena in Rosemont. Her Twin Cities show Saturday will be turned into an audio and visual livestream benefiting The Advocates for Human Rights, with her show in Rosemont feeling like the warmup.</p></figcaption><span class="line"></span><div class="Figure-credit"><p>Tyler Pasciak LaRiviere/Sun-Times</p></div></div> </figure> </div> </div><p>This tour could‚Äôve been Carlile‚Äôs well-deserved diva moment ‚Äî she just sold out two nights at the holy grail, Madison Square Garden. And even though she‚Äôs reached stardom, she has remained true to the principles that have always made her the people‚Äôs artist.</p><p>This perspective was apparent from the opening notes Friday night. As Carlile kicked off the two-plus-hour set with the title track from her new album, ‚ÄúReturning to Myself,‚Äù she did so in silhouette from behind a large curtain that displayed a giant orange orb, conjuring the image of a baby inside the womb. As the show rolled into ‚ÄúHuman,‚Äù and the curtain dropped, the birth of the world via celestial images came into play, which eventually eclipsed her own visage.</p><p>The interplay of these two songs was key to the whole show ‚Äî Carlile is not only questioning her place in her own life but life at large. It‚Äôs an introspectiveness she‚Äôs always put into her music and why she‚Äôs become so relatable in the process. It‚Äôs why her heart-wrenching music syncs at just the right moments in ‚ÄúGrey‚Äôs Anatomy‚Äù nearly 20 years ago led to the path she‚Äôs on now.</p><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="Enhancement-item" data-crop=""> <figure class="Figure"><a class="AnchorLink" id="image-450000" name="image-450000"></a> <picture data-crop="medium"> <source type="image/webp" width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/caf9796/2147483647/strip/true/crop/3000x1684+0+158/resize/490x275!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Ffa%2F47%2F5451581d405590e9190b5fb7ad4b%2Fbrandicarlile-260221-11.jpg 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/d7b944f/2147483647/strip/true/crop/3000x1684+0+158/resize/980x550!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Ffa%2F47%2F5451581d405590e9190b5fb7ad4b%2Fbrandicarlile-260221-11.jpg 2x" data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <source width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/04c3d06/2147483647/strip/true/crop/3000x1684+0+158/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Ffa%2F47%2F5451581d405590e9190b5fb7ad4b%2Fbrandicarlile-260221-11.jpg" data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <img class="Image" alt="Brandi Carlile performs at Allstate Arena in suburban Rosemont, Friday, Feb. 20, 2026. " srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/04c3d06/2147483647/strip/true/crop/3000x1684+0+158/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Ffa%2F47%2F5451581d405590e9190b5fb7ad4b%2Fbrandicarlile-260221-11.jpg 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/dfd159b/2147483647/strip/true/crop/3000x1684+0+158/resize/980x550!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Ffa%2F47%2F5451581d405590e9190b5fb7ad4b%2Fbrandicarlile-260221-11.jpg 2x" width="490" height="275" data-src="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/04c3d06/2147483647/strip/true/crop/3000x1684+0+158/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Ffa%2F47%2F5451581d405590e9190b5fb7ad4b%2Fbrandicarlile-260221-11.jpg" data-lazy-load="true" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" > </picture> <div class="Figure-content"><figcaption class="Figure-caption"><p>Brandi Carlile performs Friday at Allstate Arena in Rosemont. She released her latest album, ‚ÄúReturning To Myself,‚Äù performing many of the album‚Äôs tracks Friday. </p></figcaption><span class="line"></span><div class="Figure-credit"><p>Tyler Pasciak LaRiviere/Sun-Times</p></div></div> </figure> </div> </div><p>But the fame also gave her pause. ‚ÄúReturning To Myself,‚Äù released in October, is Carlile getting back to her roots after years working with icons and legends and becoming a wife and mother. With her family present in the arena, Carlile proudly played nearly every song on the album, which also revolves around midlife themes of losing time (‚ÄúA War With Time‚Äù) and relationship battles (‚ÄúNo One Knows Us‚Äù).</p><p>Carlile also performed a few cuts from her 2025 collaborative album with Sir Elton, ‚ÄúWho Believes in Angels?‚Äù and covers including a haunting delivery of Alanis Morissette‚Äôs ‚ÄúUninvited‚Äù and a tearjerker take on Linda Ronstadt‚Äôs ‚ÄúLong Long Time,‚Äù all of it done with her incredible storyteller wisdom and that soaring voice that rips into your chest and holds your heart. </p><p>By the encore, featuring a group effort including openers The Head and the Heart on Coldplay‚Äôs ‚ÄúViva La Vida,‚Äù the takeaway was clear: Long live life, and long live performers like Brandi Carlile that add so much to it.</p><p><i>Brandi Carlile‚Äôs ‚ÄúBe A Human: A Concert For Minneapolis‚Äù airs at 7 p.m. Feb. 21 on VEEPS; find more info </i><a class="Link" href="https://veeps.com/brandicarlile/10bee30f-604a-40a8-9c39-6a0a6553d878?utm_source=press&utm_medium=organic&utm_campaign=press-brandicarlile" target="_blank" ><i><u>here. </u></i></a></p><h3>Brandi Carlile set list for Feb. 20 show at Allstate Arena</h3><p>Returning to Myself<br>Human<br>Mainstream Kid<br>Swing for the Fences (Brandi Carlile and Elton John song)<br>A War With Time<br>A Woman Oversees<br>Right On Time<br>Who Believes in Angels? (Brandi Carlile and Elton John song)<br>Hiding My Heart<br>Stay Gentle<br>You Without Me<br>The Mother<br>The Story<br>You and Me on the Rock<br>No One Knows Us<br>Sinners, Saints and Fools<br>Long Long Time (Linda Ronstadt cover)<br>The Joke<br>Hold Out Your Hand</p><p><b>Encore</b><br>Viva La Vida (Coldplay cover, with The Head and the Heart)<br>Church & State<br>Uninvited (Alanis Morissette cover)<br>A Long Goodbye</p>
